bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

body.p: IN THE U.S. DISTRICT COURT OF THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN.DIVISION.
In the matter of the application of K. Gregory et al. for a writ of Habeas Corpus.

KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS: That P. Yakimoff as principal, and Samuel H. Weber, residing at 1509 E. Spruce St. in the City of Seattle, Washington, and Samuel Cohen, residing at 2205 E. Spruce St. Seattle, Washington, as sureties are held and firmly bound into the United States of America in the full sum of Two Hundred and Fifty Dollars ($250.00) to be paid to the United States, for which payment well and truly made, we, and each of us, do bind ourselves, our heirs, executors, and administrators, jointly and severally, firmly by these presents.
Sealed with our seals and dated this 24th day of Feb, 1914

WHEREAS: P. Yakimoff an alien, a native of Russia, who arrived at the Port of Seattle on 22 day of Dec 1913 has been held by the Immigration Board ordered the said alien to be deported, and WHEREAS: the United States District Court for the westen District of Washington, Northern Division discharged the said alien on a Writ of Habeas Corpus, and WHEREAS: The Court ordered the said alien be enlarged upon recognizance with surety, for appearance to answer judgement of the appelate Court; NOW, THEREFORE, the condition of this obligation is such that if the above named principal P Yakimoff appears to answer and carry out the Judgment of the United States Circuit COurt of Appeals for the ninth Circuit, of the Appelate Court, then this obligation to be void otherwise to remain in full force and effect.
Signed and sealed in the presence of
